RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PLANET FROLIC settled off the rail the first turn, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the nod two deep approaching the quarter pole, drifted into the lane but dueled clear toward mid-stretch and was taken in hand late. VIENNA'S TWIRL surged clear and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, gave up the lead approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn but dropped back nearing mid-stretch and settled for second best. I LOVE MARIA settled inside on the opening turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then dueled through the stretch for third. BEST WORST IDEA rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. DREAM OF GOLD broke a step slow then lunged from the gate and saved ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. NINETY PROOF veered out leaving the gate, rounded the first turn about the three path and picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, but showed little response. IVY WAY ducked in leaving the gate and rounded the first turn about the four path, left the turn outside and showed little response.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 68. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 29 Allowed 4 lbs. (Rac es Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IHEARTRAINACOMN rated a slim lead inside, was met into the backstretch and came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, briefly ceded the nod to SPARKLEINYOUREYE approaching the quarter pole but recovered the advantage past the eighth pole and was steadily handled in the lane. The latter stalked off the rail, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and took a brief lead two deep nearing the quarter, was caught passing the eighth pole and relented in the duel through the stretch. PHILMARY CASTLE rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and dug in through the stretch to hold third. KAALA stalked from the four path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. NEW AGE BAD GIRL saved ground on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. LUZIA rounded the opening turn in the four path and showed little response through the backstretch. O K SMARTY PANTS closed to contention while tapering in and stalked two deep, took a brief lead into the backstretch, gave chase from that point then faded off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Philmary Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,rail far turn,dug in lane,held 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: New Age Bad Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Krishack Joanne P and Krishack Stephan E
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased past 7/16,rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: O K Smarty Pants
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,brief lead 1/2,chased,faded off rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MACHEN MARGARITAS veered in at the break then took a quick lead while angling to the inside, rounded the turn at the rail and was steadily handled in the lane. SHE'S A BRICKHOUSE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and dug in through the lane to take second the final yards. JUBA'S PUNCH chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and was outfinished for second late yards. TRUE INDY chased, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. PRINCESS MARGARET veered in at the break then picked up the chase, rounded the turn in the four path and ran evenly in the stretch. TRUE BUCKPASSING gave chase outside, raced in the four path on the turn and finished well; outside. RIGHT TO REFUSE ducked out leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. COLD CASH gave chase and raced off the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: True Buckpassing
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Machen Margaritas
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in break,rated pace inside,rail turn,steady urging lane

ENTRY.NAME: True Indy
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Juba's Punch
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 29 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered Fo r $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KARMA BUS was hustled to contention inside and raced with the pace, raced at the rail on the turn, dueled clear past the eighth pole and held well under steady handling. MAGICAL SURPRISE veered out leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and dug in to take second the final yards. EL PACHO raced with the pace through the backstretch, raced at even terms two deep on the turn but dropped back entering the stretch and ceded second in late yards. GOLDEN ARROW gave chase, raced in the four and five paths on the turn, left the turn outside and passed some rivals. BORN TO SIN gave chase then faded off the rail on the turn. S S MIRAGE broke a step slow, gave chase through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. DONNIE B saved ground. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul for alleged interference through the turn, lodged by the rider of El Pacho, against the rider of Karma Bus.

ENTRY.NAME: Karma Bus
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled inside,rail turn,clear past 1/8,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Magical Surprise
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,chased,off rail turn,up 2nd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUE TWIRLIN stalked off the rail the first turn and drew to even terms leaving the half mile pole, dueled for the nod past the five sixteenths, contested the advantage two deep on the far turn and was steadily handled through the lane. SKYLAR'S SISTER rounded the opening turn about the four path, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and raced close in the three path on the far turn, then dueled for second nearing mid-stretch. MARTHARITA settled in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. SUPERSNAKE rated close inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. WICKED SAUCY rated the pace inside, was met into the backstretch and dueled from that point, gave up the lead passing the five sixteenths pole, raced close at the rail through the far turn but weakened inside the eighth pole. THE MONEY MACHINE rounded the opening turn about the five path, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but flattened stride on the far turn. BLUESKYSLOOKINATME stalked from the four path the first turn, moved to even terms leaving the turn and gave chase through the backstretch, but faded readily on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Martharita
ENTRY.OWNER: Horner, Ellen G. and Tria Pell Dove

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 88. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MINISTRY OF MAGIC settled off the pace in the four path the first turn, bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved, rounded the far turn three wide and dug in to edge out REMYS SHOWTIME through later yards. The latter stalked from the three path, challenged Colt Rock toward the seven sixteenths pole, took the nod two deep at the quarter pole, raced clear into the lane but was met mid-stretch and relented later yards. ROCKIN THE PALACE settled off the rail the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the seven path and dug in widest to take third under the wire. MACHEN'S RIDGE was unprepared for the break then saved ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, left the turn between horses and finished evenly but was nipped from third under the wire. TIMMY saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole but raced hemmed in past the quarter, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little further. COLT ROCK took the lead while tapering in and rated the pace, dug in to the challenge of Remys Showtime leaving the seven sixteenths pole, gave the nod to that one at the rail at the quarter pole and flattened inside the eighth pole. MAKOTO rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. CHANGE YOUR LUCK rounded the opening turn in the four path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Timmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,hemmed in past 1/4,rail turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ministry of Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st turn,bid 7/16,3wd far turn,dug in,edged up later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Rockin the Palace
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,7p far turn,3rd wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 29 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weigh t Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DERBY DAY DREAMS gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail, dug in past the eighth pole and got up the final yards. CARIBBEAN PLEASURE bore out leaving the gate then pressured the pace, took the lead two deep past the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady handling but was caught while flattening stride the final yards. TAP SECRET chased inside through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three and four paths, drifted leaving the turn but dug in to take third the final yards while gaining on the waning runner-up. JEFFERSON NATIVE set a pressured pace inside, was caught leaving the five sixteenths pole, remained a close factor into the turn but dropped back midway through the turn and flattened in the lane. TIZ NO CLOWN was shuffled back leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path, drifted toward the head of the lane and flattened later yards. BO'S BOURBON gave chase, raced in the six path on the turn and showed little in the lane. BRISTOL CHANNEL saved ground. The Stewards reviewed, then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Caribbean Pleasure for alleged interference leaving the gate, lodged by the rider of Tiz No Clown.

ENTRY.NAME: Jefferson Native
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,caught past 5/16,rail turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Derby Day Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Caribbean Pleasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore out break,pressed pace,up past 5/16,rail turn,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Bo's Bourbon
ENTRY.OWNER: Metz Larry and Bone Robert D

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 29, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since May 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowe d 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INDIANA RED saved ground well off the pace, gave chase leaving the first turn and steadily improved, raced off the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady handling to get up the final yards. MONTAUK DADDY stalked off the rail then challenged approaching the five sixteenths pole, took the nod approaching the quarter pole, dueled clear into the lane but was caught flattening stride the final yards. PROTA rated the pace inside, dug in to the challenge of Montauk Daddy nearing the five sixteenths pole, ceded to that one at the rail approaching the quarter, dropped back into the lane and flattened the final sixteenth. ELVIRUS settled off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly in the lane. NEWS BOX saved early ground then gave chase from the half mile pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and ran evenly in the stretch. NOTION TO TAPIT raced in the five path the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the six path and showed little in the lane. TOP OF THE MINT broke through the gate prior the break, raced in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. CRIMSON ROCKET rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. PRINCE OF FENTON raced off the rail the opening turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole then weakened at the rail on the far turn. HEY CONGRATS stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Prota
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Prince of Fenton
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn
